resources.string: This feature requires permission \"Usage Statistics\", it has to be manually enabled in Settings. \nOpen that Setting page?
When enabled, the filter only applies when both number and content match
The global switch, this app only works when this is turned on, a quick way to \"disable\" all the filters, turn this off when you temporarily want to receive some call/SMS.

Permit if the call is repeated within a period of time, because repeated calls are less likely to be spam. Prior to other filters below.

It works by checking the history records in the app's database, so do not delete the history records too frequently, being texted by the same number also counts.

The default setting "1 Time / 5 Min" means the second call within 5 minutes will be permitted.
Permit if the call is from a contact. Prior to other filters below.

Permitted any incoming call if any app in the list has been used recently.

A typical use case:
You ordered a pizza in PizzaApp, soon they call you to refund because they are closing. That call would pass if PizzaApp is enabled here. Prior to the filters below.

The default setting "5 Min" means any call will be permitted if any of those apps has been used within 5 minutes, by "used" it means being activated, or minimized, or killed.
Regex patterns that applied to the phone number, the \"priority\" is ordered together with the "Sms Content Filters" below.
Regex patterns that applied to sms content, the \"priority\" is ordered together with the "Phone Number Filters" above.

None: No notification at all. 
Shade: The dropdown notification shade. 
StatusBar: The small icon in the top bar.
Sound: The default notification sound.
Heads-Up: Popups a floating window on the top of the screen. (default for Whitelist)
